page.title: 13ASTLEY CASTLE(contd)
page.content: stories with attics and has a lead and tile roof.The chimneys are 16th and 17th century,as is the porch.The main door is also from the 16th century and has strap hinges.Before the fire most of the decorations were from the 19th century with 20th century additions, although the room layout and main decoration dates from restoration in the 1820's. Rooms include a panelled entrance hall,kitchens and a domestic area,4 reception rooms and the upper floor consists mainly of modern bedrooms. The original small park had been laid out in 1500 by the Marquess of Dorset who enclosed 30 acres.He later enclosed 18 acres in Astley and 90 acres in Arley to make his,"Great Park",which no longer exists.
